title: Optimal investment with inside information and parameter uncertainty
abstract:
An optimal investment problem is solved for an insider who has access to noisy\ud
information related to a future stock price, but who does not know the stock price drift. The\ud
drift is ﬁltered from a combination of price observations and the privileged information,\ud
fusing a partial information scenario with enlargement of ﬁltration techniques. We apply\ud
a variant of the Kalman–Bucy ﬁlter to infer a signal, given a combination of an observation process and some additional information. This converts the combined partial and inside\ud
information model to a full information model, and the associated investment problem for\ud
HARA utility is explicitly solved via duality methods. We consider the cases in which the\ud
agent has information on the terminal value of the Brownian motion driving the stock, and\ud
on the terminal stock price itself. Comparisons are drawn with the classical partial information case without insider knowledge. The parameter uncertainty results in stock price inside\ud
information being more valuable than Brownian information, and perfect knowledge of the\ud
future stock price leads to inﬁnite additional utility. This is in contrast to the conventional\ud
case in which the stock drift is assumed known, in which perfect information of any kind\ud
leads to unbounded additional utility, since stock price information is then indistinguishable\ud
from Brownian information
